reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a chance and simply showed up here one fall afternoon as we drove from the Spanish Pais Vasco through France to the Pyrennes. What luck we had. We were met by Jean-Pierre, and our adventure began. We were given the choice of two rooms, and chose the larger one, which had ceilings perhaps 11-12' high, a king bed (two twins pushed together as is the custom in Europe), a sitting area with a bowl of fruit, and a large modern bathroom with aqua blue tiles and with both a shower and a tub. The decor was very pleasant and homey and real. This is not a place that is trying to be a castle and would not appeal to people seeking a "castle-experience" complete with tapestries and stone walls etc. It is very much someone's home, with personal objects and touches.
reviews.title: A culinary treasure in a tranquil country setting
